location.description: Strictly extract the location in the format 'Country, Region/State, City'. If only the city is mentioned, return 'Unknown, Unknown, City'. Never return null/empty string.

level.description: If level is mentioned, match it with enums, if not use Unknown

start.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. If only year or month/year is available, use YYYY-01-01 or YYYY-MM-01. If ongoing, use 'Present'.

end.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. If only year or month/year is available, use YYYY-01-01 or YYYY-MM-01. If ongoing, use 'Present'.

location.description: Strictly extract the location in the format 'Country, Region/State, City'. If only the city is mentioned, return 'Unknown, Unknown, City'. Never return null/empty string.

start.description: Named date they started in format yyyy-mm-dd

end.description: Named date they started in format yyyy-mm-dd

location.description: Strictly extract the location in the format 'Country, Region/State, City'. If only the city is mentioned, return 'City'. Never return null/empty string

achievements.description: A list of significant professional, academic, or personal achievements, awards, and recognitions that are not categorized as work experience or education. Focus on results and quantified success. If none leace an empty array

projects.description: A list of personal or professional projects (side projects, open-source contributions, academic thesis, or significant internal initiatives) that demonstrate skills. Prioritize technical and results-driven projects. If none, leave an empty array

start.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. If only year or month/year is available, use YYYY-01-01 or YYYY-MM-01. If ongoing, use 'Present'.

end.description: Date in YYYY-MM-DD format. If only year or month/year is available, use YYYY-01-01 or YYYY-MM-01. If ongoing, use 'Present'.

skills.description: A list of key, specific, and domain-relevant skills, technologies, or tools used and demonstrated in this particular context (e.g., project or job). Exclude generic skills unless highly relevant. Ensure skills are listed as singular concepts (e.g., 'Python', not 'Python programming').
